column4: if ubuntu has sound enabled, do I need to create a symlink to /dev/dsp to get these programs to work properly?
symlink from where?
from whichever device is sound to /dev/dsp
i think /dev/dsp is created when the alsa oss-compat mixer module is loaded
how would I do that? if you don't mind :)
try sudo modprobe snd-mixer-oss
it's running but I still can't get sound
do you also have snd-pcm-oss?
but you don't have a /dev/dsp?
I don't have a /dev/dsp
anything in dmesg or /var/log/syslog about dsp?
it says nothing about dsp
that's about as much as I thought I knew about alsa, i'm afraid
hey, do you have a printer port?
yep
were there solutions?
well I have /dev/dsp
it's just not letting me use it
i think esd grabs it. which app are you trying to use
just the media player that comes with gnome
we deliberately chose not to install build-essential (my call)
I don't like that for now
